ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry reveals mild sloping to moderate sensorineural hearing loss bilaterally; history is progressive.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cochlear distortion or retrocochlear involvement
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Word recognition scores are disproportionately poor (50-52%) relative to pure-tone thresholds, suggesting significant distortion or neural pathology.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition ability, particularly given complaints of clarity.
To assess the acoustic reflex arc and screen for retrocochlear pathology.
To measure dynamic range and establish upper limits for hearing aid output.
To verify that hearing aid gain and output match prescribed NAL-NL1 targets.
To verify the transparency and telecoil response of the FM system.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation revealed bilateral mild sloping to moderate sensorineural hearing loss. Word recognition scores were disproportionately poor (approx 50%) bilaterally, suggesting significant cochlear distortion. Middle ear function was normal, though contralateral reflexes were elevated or absent.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right: Mild SNHL (250-6000 Hz) sloping to moderate at 8000 Hz. Left: Mild SNHL (250-500 Hz) sloping to moderate (1000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: 40 dB HL (Right), 45 dB HL (Left). WRS: 52% (Right), 50% (Left) at 40 dB SL (poor).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral reflexes normal; contralateral reflexes elevated or absent.

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDLs)
tests.result_summary: Frequency-specific LDLs measured (e.g., 80-90 dB HL) to guide fitting.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Fitting and verification of new hearing aids and FM system. Real-ear measures confirmed gain matched NAL-NL1 targets and output was appropriate. FM verification confirmed transparency and appropriate telecoil response.

tests.name: Real-ear measures (REM)
tests.result_summary: REIG matched NAL-NL1 targets for 50, 65, and 80 dB SPL inputs. RESR90 curves corresponded to LDLs.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: FM Verification: RSETS 0.9 dB (Right) and 2.4 dB (Left). FM transparency confirmed (EFMHA65 within acceptable range of EHA65).

proposed_items: Fit bilateral Phonak Exelia Art M BTE hearing aids with Lucite earmolds.
Fit Phonak SmartLink+ transmitter and MyLink+ neckloop FM system.
Program hearing aids to NAL-NL1 targets.
Enable telecoil and FM programs (mic only, telecoil only, mic + telecoil).
Pair FM transmitter with Bluetooth cell phone.
Provide audio input cords for television use.
counseling_actions: Explained that poor word recognition scores indicate clarity issues that gain alone cannot fix.
Counseled on realistic expectations for amplification given the distortion.
Instructed on proper use of FM microphone (placement close to speaker).
Instructed on use of hearing aid programs and Bluetooth connectivity.

escalation.rationale_short: Patient requires routine follow-up to monitor performance with new amplification and FM system.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor benefit from hearing aids and FM system.

expected_outcome: Patient reported new hearing aids were much clearer than previous ones and provided better hearing alone.
Patient reported using the FM system in church, restaurants, watching television, and playing cards.
Patient was able to turn off TV captions for news; FM system was helpful for movies.
Communication with husband improved and patient resumed social activities like dining out.
Patient stated that the explanation of her WRS helped her understand her hearing challenges.
